sen.j: 畠山重忠の乱（はたけやましげただのらん）は、鎌倉時代初期の元久2年6月22日 (旧暦)（1205年7月10日）、武蔵国二俣川（現神奈川県横浜市旭区 (横浜市)保土ケ谷区）において、武蔵国の有力御家人・畠山重忠が武蔵掌握を図る北条時政の策謀により、北条義時率いる大軍に攻められて滅ぼされた事件。
sen.e: Shigetada HATAKEYAMA Rebellion is the rebellion in which Shigetada HATAYAMA was killed by the large army led by Yoshitoki HOJO prepared by the plot of Tokimasa HOJO; it took place at the Futamata-gawa River in the Musashi Province (present-day in Asahi Ward and Hodoyaga Ward, Yokohama City) on July 10, 1205, in the beginning of Kamakura period.

The Shigetada HATAKEYAMA Rebellion was the rebellion in which Shigetada HATAKEYAMA was killed in an attack by a large army, planned by Tokimasa HOJO and executed by Yoshitoki HOJO; it took place at the Futamata-gawa River in the Musashi Province (present-day Asahi Ward and Hodogaya Ward, Yokohama City) on July 10, 1205 in the early Kamakura period.

sen.e: The Shigetada HATAKEYAMA Rebellion was the rebellion in which Shigetada HATAKEYAMA was killed in an attack by a large army, planned by Tokimasa HOJO and executed by Yoshitoki HOJO; it took place at the Futamata-gawa River in the Musashi Province (present-day Asahi Ward and Hodogaya Ward, Yokohama City) on July 17, 1205 in the early Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に変換

sen.j: 鎌倉幕府内部の政争で北条氏による有力御家人排斥の一つ。
sen.e: It is a political strife among the insiders of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) and was one of the rebellions the Hojo clan began intending the expulsion of senior vessals.
It was one of the expulsions of senior vassals carried out by the HOJO clan in times of political strife in the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: 時制の訂正と構文を簡潔にしました。
sen.e: It was one of the expulsions of senior vassals carried out by the HOJO clan in times of political strife in the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

sen.j: 鎌倉幕府創設者である初代将軍源頼朝の死後、幕府内部の権力闘争が続き正治2年（1200年）の梶原景時の変、建仁3年（1203年）の比企能員の変によって有力者が滅ぼされ、幕府の実権は14歳の3代将軍源実朝を擁する北条時政が握っていた。
sen.e: After the death of MINAMOTO no Yoritomo, the founder of the Kamakura bakufu, strifes over authority within the bakufu continued and numbers of political leaders were killed in the the Kagetoki Kajiwara Incident (1200) and in the Conspiracy of Yoshikazu HIKI (1203); the real power was held by Tokimasa HOJO, in the place of the third generation of the Minamoto clan, MINAMOTO no Sanetomo, who was 14 years-old.

After the death of MINAMOTO no Yoritomo, the founder of the Kamakura bakufu, political strife over authority within the bakufu continued to happen, resulting in the deaths of political leaders in such cases as the Kagetoki Kajiwara Incident (1200) and the Conspiracy of Yoshikazu HIKI (1203), and it was in fact Tokimasa HOJO who had political authority over 14 year-old MINAMOTO no Sanetomo, the third shogun of the Kamakura bakufu.

sen.j: 畠山重忠は秩父氏が代々継承してきた武蔵国の武士団を統率する留守所総検校職の地位にあり、その武勇と人望により頼朝の時代には常に戦陣を務め、その死に際して子孫を守護するように遺言を受けた有力御家人であった。
sen.e: Shigetada HATAKEYAMA was in the position of Rusudokoro (the center for all local government administration in a province) sokengyo (president of the Todo-za), who led the armed groups of the Musashi Province, and due to his courageousness as samurai and his personal magnetism, he was ordered to participate in all the battles during the time of Yoritomo, and was also asked by Yoritomo to protect his grandhildren in the will.

Shigetada HATAKEYAMA, (acting) provincial governor who controlled samurai groups in the Musashi Province, which the Chichibu clan used to do for generations, was a senior vassal who had significant courage and confidence to be in charge of every battle that happened during the Yoritomo shogunate and was asked to protect Yoritomo's grandchildren in Yoritomo's will.

sen.j: また時政の前妻の娘婿であり、梶原景時の変、比企能員の変ではいずれも北条氏側に協力していた。
sen.e: He was also an adopted son-in-law of Tokimasa's former wife, and he was taking the side of the Hojo clan when he participated in the Kagetoki Kajiwara Incident and the Conspiracy of Yoshikazu HIKI.
He, a son-in-law of Tokimasa's first wife, was on HOJO's side during the Kagetoki Kajiwara Incident and the Conspiracy of Yoshikazu HIKI.

sen.j: 武蔵国は将軍によって国司が推挙される関東御分国（将軍家知行国）の一つであり、数多の武士団が存在し、鎌倉防衛の戦略上の要地であった。
sen.e: The Musashi Province was one of the provincial territories that belonged to the Kamakura Bakufu where kokushi (provincial governor) were nominated by shogun; many samurai groups existed there and was one of the strategically important locations to defend Kamakura.

The Musashi Province was one of the provincial territories that belonged to the Kamakura Bakufu where kokushi (provincial governors) were nominated by the shogun; many samurai groups existed there and it was strategically one of the most important locations for the defense of Kamakura.

sen.j: この頃の武蔵国司は、時政の後妻牧の方の娘婿平賀朝雅であり、比企能員の変の翌月の建仁3年（1203年）10月、朝雅は京都守護のため上洛し、朝雅の上洛後に時政が将軍実朝の命によって武蔵国務職に任じられ、武蔵国衙の行政権を掌握していた。
sen.e: At that time, the kokushi of the Musashi Province was Tomomasa HIRAGA, the adopted son-in-law of Tokimasa's second wife, however, he went to the capital (Kyoto) in October 1203 as the military governor of Kyoto, and after that, Tokimasa was appointed as 武蔵国務職 and held executive power of the Musashi no Kokuga (local government of Musashi).
sen.cmt: 武蔵国務職の訳は不明。
sen.e: In October 1203, when Tomomasa HIRAGA, the kokushi of Musashi Province and the son-in-law of Tokimasa's second wife, went to the capital (Kyoto) as the military governor of Kyoto, Tokimasa came to hold executive power of the Musashi no Kokuga (local government of Musashi) as ordered by the shogun Sanetomo.
sen.cmt: ●文章を理解しやすいように書換えました。●武蔵国務職の定訳不明のため、「武蔵国務職に任じられ」部分を訳出しませんでした。
sen.e: In November 1203, when Tomomasa HIRAGA, the kokushi of Musashi Province and the son-in-law of Tokimasa's second wife, went to the capital (Kyoto) as the military governor of Kyoto, Tokimasa came to hold executive power of the Musashi no Kokuga (local government of Musashi) as ordered by the shogun Sanetomo.

sen.j: 元久元年（1204年）11月4日 (旧暦)、京の平賀朝雅亭で、将軍源実朝の妻坊門信清の娘を迎えるために上洛した御家人たちの歓迎の酒宴が行われた。
sen.e: On November 4, 1204, a drinking party was held at the residence of Tomomasa HIRAGA for the gokenin (immediate vassals of the shogunate in the Kamakura and Muromachi through Edo periods)who came to Kyoto to welcome the daughter of Shogun Sanemoto.

On December 3, 1204, a party was held at Tomomasa HIRAGA's residence for gokenin (immediate vassals of the shogunate in the Kamakura and Muromachi through Edo periods) who came to Kyoto to welcome Shogun Sanetomo's wife, a daughter of Nobukiyo Bomon.

sen.j: その席で朝雅と重忠の嫡子畠山重保との間で言い争いとなり、周囲の取りなしで事は収まったが、これが後に大きな争いの火種となる。
sen.e: At this party, Tomomasa and Shigeyasu HATAKEYAMA began fighting; even if this first fight did not develop into a big one for the people around them stopped it, but this incident became the cause of the later conflict.
At the party, Tomomasa and Shigeyasu HATAKEYAMA, a legitimate child of Shigetada, had an argument that others present managed to calm down; however it later led to a serious dispute.

sen.e: On November 5 of the following year, Tomomasa HOJO, who was in Kyoto with Shigeyasu, and Masanori HOJO, his second wife Maiki no kata's son died of illness.
On December 4, 1204, Masanori HOJO, a son of Tokimasa HOJO and his second wife Maki no Kata who came to Kyoto with Shigeyasu, died of a sudden illness.

sen.j: 同年4月11日 (旧暦)、鎌倉に不穏な形勢ありとして御家人たちが集まりはじめ、所領の武蔵国に隠居していた稲毛重成が舅の時政に呼ばれ、郎党を引き連れて鎌倉へやって来た。
sen.e: On April 11 of the same year, Gokenin came to get together as they noticed the disturbing state; Shigenari INAGE, who was living in his territory (shoryo) Musashi Province after retirement, was also summoned by his Tokimasa, father-in-law, and came to Kamakura with his roto.

Having sensed a state of political turbulence in Kamakura, gokenin started gathering there on May 8, 1205; Shigenari INAGE, a senior samurai who had retired to his own territory in Musashi Province, came to Kamakura with his retainers, having been called by his father in law Tokimasa.

sen.e: On June 21, Tomomasa brought a false charge against Shigeyasu saying Tomomasa was slandered by him to Maki no kata; she claimed that it was rebellion by the Shigetada and his son.

On July 16, Tomomasa made a false charge against Shigetada to Maki no kata claiming that Shigetada had slandered Tomomasa; she claimed to Tokimasa that it was a sign of rebellion by Shigetada and his son Shigeyasu.

sen.j: 時政が子の北条義時と北条時房に重忠討伐を相談すると、2人は重忠の忠勤を訴えて謀反など起こすがはずがないと反対したが、牧の方の兄大岡時親に「牧の方が継母だから仇をしようと思っているのだろう」と迫られ、やむなく義時は重忠討伐に同意したという。
sen.e: When Tokimasa consulted Yoshitoki HOJO and Tokifusa HOJO about subdugation of Shigetada, both disagreed claiming Shigetada's loyalty that he would not rebel against them, however, as Maki no kata's older brother Tokichika Ooka said that "he is probably planning a rebel since Maki no kata is the stepmother," Yoshitoki had no choice than to agree with the subdugation.
sen.cmt: 大岡時親はTokichika Ookaとしてあります。
sen.e: When Tokimasa HOJO consulted with his sons Yoshitoki and Tokifusa about whether or not Shigetada should be subdued, they declined to do so as they believed that Shigetada was faithful enough not to rebel against them; however, it is said that Yoshitoki ended up agreeing with the idea when Maki no kata's older brother Tokichika Ooka put pressure on him by claiming that he was planning a rebellion since Maki no kata was his mother in law.
sen.cmt: 理解できる文章に書換えました。

sen.j: 同じ秩父氏の稲毛入道に招かれて鎌倉にいた重保も郎従3人と共に由比ヶ浜へ駆けつけると、時政の意を受けた三浦義村が佐久間太郎らに重保を取り囲ませる。
sen.e: When Shgeyasu, who was in Kamakura by the invitation of INAGE no Nyudo, rushed to Yugahama with three roju, Yoshimura MIURA, who was there for Yokimasa, commanded Taro Sakuma to surround Shgeyasu.

When Shigeyasu, who was staying in Kamakura after having been invited by INAGE no Nyudo from the Chichibu clan, rushed to Yuigahama with his three vassals, Yoshimura MIURA, under orders from Tokimasa, made Taro Sakuma and others surround Shigeyasu.

sen.j: 重忠の弟長野重清は信濃国、畠山重宗は奥州へ行っており、重忠が率いていたのは子の畠山重秀、郎従本田近常、乳母父の榛沢成清以下130-40騎程度に過ぎなかった。
sen.e: Shigetada's younger brother Shigekiyo NAGANO went to the Shinano Province and Shigemune HATAYAMA to Oshu, and Shigetada only led his son Shigehide HATAYAMA, Uchikatsune HONDA, the wet nurse's father, 榛沢成清, and 130 to 140 horses.

sen.e: When Shigetada realized that Shigeyasu was killed on that morning and a punitive force was on their way to attack him, Shigetada decided to wait and fight with them rather than hiding in the Sugaya-yakata, as he thought it was the right attitude for a bushi.

Having realized at the river that Shigeyasu was killed in the morning and that an army had been sent to attack him, he chose to stand and fight the army as a samurai, rather than retreat to the castle.

sen.j: そこへ義時率いる大軍が襲いかかり、激戦4時間余りののち、重忠は愛甲季隆の矢に討たれ、首級を取られた（享年42）。
sen.e: He was attacked by the huge army led by Yoshitoki, and was shot by Suetaka AIKO's arrow and had his severed head taken after four hours of severe fights (he was 42 years-old).
